member.name: M:DigitalRune.Physics.MassFrame.FromShapeAndDensity(DigitalRune.Geometry.Shapes.Shape,DigitalRune.Mathematics.Algebra.Vector3F,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes a mass frame for the given shape and density.
member.param: The relative distance threshold. If no mass or inertia formula for the given shape are known the shape is approximated with a triangle mesh and the mass frame of this mesh is returned. The relative distance threshold controls the accuracy of the approximated mesh. Good default values are 0.05 to get an approximation with an error of about 5%.

The iteration limit. For some shapes the mass properties are computed with an iterative algorithm. No more than iterations will be performed. A value of 3 gives good results in most cases. Use a value of -1 to get only a coarse approximation.
member.returns: A new for the given parameters is returned.

member.name: M:DigitalRune.Physics.MassFrame.FromShapeAndMass(DigitalRune.Geometry.Shapes.Shape,DigitalRune.Mathematics.Algebra.Vector3F,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes a mass frame for the given shape and target mass.
member.param: The target mass. The mass of the computed will be equal to this value. Other mass properties are adjusted to match the target mass.

The relative distance threshold. If no mass or inertia formula for the given shape are known the shape is approximated with a triangle mesh and the mass frame of this mesh is returned. The relative distance threshold controls the accuracy of the approximated mesh. Good default values are 0.05 to get an approximation with an error of about 5%.

The iteration limit. For some shapes the mass properties are computed with an iterative algorithm. No more than iterations will be performed. A value of 3 gives good results in most cases. Use a value of -1 to get only a coarse approximation.
member.returns: A new for the given parameters is returned.
